page.title: 10***** LOCAL WILDLIFE *****
page.content: A particularly interesting aspect of the natural history of the S.Hetton area is the recolonisation of what have previously been railway lines supplying the industrial site around the colliery. These disused lines are used as footpaths by the local inhabitants and display a wide variety of plant and animal life, which has developed rapidly since the lines were closed. Common plant species include,gorse rose bay willow herb,hawthorn,bramble vetch,plantains and numerous grasses. Interesting animals regularly spotted by walkers are dragonflies ground beetles,toads,hares and a wide variety of birdlife notably swifts, yellowhammers, wrens and kestrels which are numerous along the lines.
